thread.title: Groups plan appeal of ruling on Arizona immigration law
thread.title_full: Groups plan appeal of ruling on Arizona immigration law

title: Groups plan appeal of ruling on Arizona immigration law
text:
Groups plan appeal of ruling on Arizona immigration law By - Associated Press - Monday, October 5, 2015 
PHOENIX (AP) - Groups that tried to overturn Arizona’s 2010 immigration enforcement law say they will appeal a judge’s decision that signaled an end of the last of seven legal challenges to the contentious statute. 
The challenge was dismissed a month ago after a judge upheld the law’s most controversial section and ruled the groups had failed to show that police would enforce it differently for Latinos than it would for people of other ethnicities. 
The judge had upheld the law’s requirement that police, while enforcing other laws, can question the immigration status of those suspected of being in the country illegally. 
Even though the September ruling marked a victory for the law’s supporters, the courts have blocked enforcement of other sections of the statute.
